description: From Middle English helfe, helve; from Old English hielfe, from Proto-Germanic *halbiją.

entries.meaning: The handle or haft of a tool or weapon.
examples: It was the bad ax-helve someone had sold me— / “Made on machine,” he said, plowing the grain  […]

entries.meaning: A forge hammer lifted by a cam acting on the helve between the fulcrum and the head.

verbs.description: helve (third-person singular simple present helves, present participle helving, simple past and past participle helved)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To furnish (an axe, etc.) with a helve.
